titleStmt.title: The good patriot set forth in the example of the publick-spirited centurion in a sermon preached in the Gray-Friar Church of Edinburgh, on the first Munday of June, 168-, being the day ordinarly [sic] observed for the anniversary commemoration of George Herriot, the religious founder of the hospital called after his name Herriots Hospital.
titleStmt.author: Mackqueen, John, d. 1734.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
